meanings.definition: Gradually reducing or extinguishing a debt through regular payments.
meanings.sent1: The amortizing of his mortgage allowed him to slowly pay off his house.
meanings.sent2: The company's amortizing of its loans helped them manage their finances effectively.
meanings.sent3: She joked that her cat was amortizing its treats by only eating a little bit each day.
meanings.sent4: The sunset seemed to be amortizing the sky, with colors fading gradually.
meanings.sent5: The concept of amortizing a debt was explained through a simple story about saving coins in a piggy bank.

meanings.definition: The process of spreading out the cost of an intangible asset over a period of time.
meanings.sent1: The amortizing of the software development costs allowed the company to budget more effectively.
meanings.sent2: Amortizing the patent fees over several years helped reduce the immediate financial burden.
meanings.sent3: The idea of amortizing a virtual reality experience over a week sounded amusingly futuristic.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed in the room, amortizing the tension that had been building up.
meanings.sent5: The artist described his creative process as amortizing inspiration, letting ideas develop slowly over time.

meanings.definition: To pay off a loan or debt in installments.
meanings.sent1: They were amortizing their car loan by making monthly payments.
meanings.sent2: She amortized her student debt by setting aside a portion of her salary each month.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel seemed to be amortizing its acorn collection by burying them in different spots.
meanings.sent4: He felt like he was amortizing his time, spending it wisely to achieve his goals.
meanings.sent5: The athlete approached training as a way to amortize his efforts, gradually improving his performance over time.
